result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Bryan Melaven

defendant.name: Melaven, David Bryan
defendant.address: 4548 South Delaware Avenue, St Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Bryan Melaven appeared by video.  Attorney Jamie J Pagac appeared by video for David Bryan Melaven.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case may resolve with an informal resolution. Parties are requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 12-8-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David Bryan Melaven in court with attorney Jamie J Pagac.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David Bryan Melaven appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel still needs discovery and offer from state.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
 Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant David Bryan Melaven in court with Attorney Jamie J Pagac.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
RECALLED 10:10
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.E.M
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
